Squashed away

Is there never any need to remove LEDs, such as when a card with an LED is removed from the system? Even if there isn't at the moment, I wonder if it would be a good idea to make it explicit, like by adding an arg, that this is doing an add, so it's easier to add a remove later if necessary.

RemoveLed is also a method which is used in this interface "xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Internal". 
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-led-sysfs/+/57455/8/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Led/Internal.interface.yaml#14
For now, AddLed method is implemented, if it requires RemoveLed can also be added later.
Any reason this isn't a log call?
No, I have updated lg2 in latest patchset.
Please use lg2 on new code.
Done

Hi Jayashree, thanks for the patch. I've made a bunch of comments. Most of them are kinda nit-picky but I feel that addressing them will improve the readability of the code. There are a few in particular that are more significant:

1. The name of the binary and its installation path
2. The addition of a comment as documentation about how you expect the binary to be invoked, including a concrete example of its command-line arguments
3. The behaviour around parsing the sysfs path
I have addressed all your comments. Please provide your suggestions on the latest patchset,

Unfortunately I'm not a huge fan of the file name, I think the 'method_call' component is too abstract given its specific implementation. Can we call it add-led-action.cpp and compile it to an 'add-led-action' binary that we put in /usr/libexec/phosphor-led-sysfs/?
Done
I think we just need `sdbusplus/bus.hpp` as we're not starting a server here, just connecting to a DBus session.
Done
I think this would be better named 'ledConnection'
Done
'ledPath'
Done
Maybe 'ledPresenceInterface'?
Done
'ledAddMethod'?
Done
maybe 'LED_CLASS_ROOT'?
Done
This is only called once in the code in main(). I prefer we open-code the implementation in the body of the condition.
Done
I think this path should cause us to exit with a negative error code, otherwise it will look like the operation succeeded to the rest of the system.
Done

Can you please add a comment that demonstrates how the binary will be invoked by udev so we can get a feeling for the content of argv?

Also I'd prefer we specify the type of argv as `const char* argv[]` :)

Done

ArgumentParser is also used in controller.cpp file, I will change argv to const in the future patches.

This is probably the one thing that does need to be put in a separate function, IMO :)

Concretely, this is a behaviour implemented in terms of the specification of sysfs. We should check that the value passed in is in-fact a path rooted at DEVPATH before we substring into it. Further, we should exit with an error code if the provided path is not rooted at DEVPATH, because there's no way we can make sense of it. Ideally we'd specify the function behaviour in terms of pre- and post- conditions and write some tests to validate the behaviour too :)
Done
"methodCall" is far too abstract here. The implementation always calls the AddLed() method on the DBus object, so we should call the function "AddLed"
Done
See my commentary in the implementation.
Done

This is an anti-pattern: https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/anti-patterns.md#incorrect-placement-of-executables-in-sbin-usrsbin-or-bin-usrbin

The binary should go in /usr/libexec/phosphor-led-sysfs
Done
Throw std::invalid_argument?
Done

I don't see the reason to use 'exit' here.  There isn't much value in having caught any exception.  Let it go up the stack and the application crash.  Calling 'exit' directly doesn't call destructors and really shouldn't be used much in C++ code.
Done
Just `throw e`.  This isn't necessarily an invalid argument.
Done
What's with the addition of all the leading spaces?
Removed the space and updated the patchset.
What's going on here?

Primary service - xyz.openbmc_project.led.controller.service
Second service - sysfs-led@.service

Second service is started after the primary service. Before initializing the dbus method (AddLed) for LED from primary service, second service is started based on udev events and invoking the dbus method, therefore, it fails for first 2 events.
Therefore, it waits for sometime and invoking the dbus method (AddLed) to add the LEDs.

Okay. Can you please try configuring the LED controller service as a DBus-activated service to see if that improves the reliability? I'd much prefer we construct it as a reliable operation if we can, not paper over the problem with retries.

Here's a SO comment describing what's required for systemd DBus activation:

https://stackoverflow.com/a/31725112
Done
Th

This change stands on its own, but the executable it generates is required by the first two patches. The first two patches need to come some time after this one, and I think this one needs to go before the previous two patches. The with the udev rule change probably needs to be squashed into the one that changes the daemon implementation.

Does that make sense?
Each patch is independent of others and the order of the patches has been changed.
Why not 'auto' or 'size_t'?  ulong is usually wrong for 64-bit architectures.
Done
Done

FWIW:

```
cpp-style-and-conventions.md:Prefer '#pragma once' header guard over '#ifndef'-style.
```
Done

Reviving this series. Apologies if there is any need to re-explain things to me. 
Tried out the code and it looks ok besides a few minor issues.
Hi Alexander, I have a couple of straight-forward comments.

Add a wrap for this please (`cli11.wrap`). Apparently others have specified it as:

```
[wrap-git]
url = https://github.com/CLIUtils/CLI11
revision = HEAD
```
i think this was added some time ago https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-led-sysfs/blob/master/subprojects/CLI11.wrap
why re-order these? the were alphabetically ordered before, which is at least sensible.

i don't think i did any reordering here, maybe there's a problem with my vision. The diff Base vs Patchset 24 shows no changes.

Taking into acount squashing the previous commit, i added the new dependency at the end of the array.

Mhm, looking at Patchset 23 vs Patchset 24 shows that there is a change and re-ordering.

Which does not need to be there since this patch is not about re-ordering things.

Let's look at the diff vs Base and discuss that.
